summary: A social platform with Internet Identity authentication using 6-character user IDs instead of phone numbers
architectural_notes: Uses Internet Identity for authentication (passkeys, Google, Apple, Microsoft)
User identification via 6-character IDs instead of phone numbers
ID system supports both auto-generated and custom user-created IDs

existing_features.title: Remove all phone number collection and validation logic from the authentication flow, including PhoneNumberSetup component and phone number storage in user profiles
Create ID claim/creation dialog that appears for new users on first login, allowing them to either accept their auto-generated 6-character ID or create a custom 6-character ID for free
Update all frontend displays that show user IDs to use the new 6-character format, including profile display, layout header, and any admin panels
Remove phone number admin whitelist functionality and any phone number-related admin controls from the admin panel

new_feature_requests.summary: Remove phone number authentication and switch to ID-based system
Implement 6-character user ID system with auto-generation and custom ID option
Add ID claim/creation flow for new users on first login
Implement 6-character alphanumeric ID system where new users are automatically assigned a unique 6-character ID (letters and numbers) upon first login if they don't have one
Update user profile storage to use 6-character IDs as the primary identifier, replacing the current PUR-XXXXXX format userId with the new 6-character format
Keep Internet Identity authentication system unchanged as the primary login method, with users authenticating via passkeys, Google, Apple, or Microsoft
